page.title: 18Chemical Works
page.content: We spent a morning at Bush, Boake Allen, the Liston Gardens factory where they{distil}essential oils and create concentrated tastes; some are the 'real macoy'(e.g.onions) and some are synthetic (e.g.smokey bacon has never seen a piglet!{Stafford Allen, a relative of Allen and Hanbury, set out to improve the quality of 'simple' medicines used by the very poor, 160 years ago. The firm moved out of London and now has a huge site on both banks of the Stour; there used to be a farm. The Allens were{Quakers}and they looked after their workers far better than other employers in those days, but you did what "Sir" said! We all had to wear white caps for going round the works, and we were given lots of specimens - the{spices}seem to come mostly from tropical countries, but some 'escapes' grow by the roadside!
